title: Re: new user awesome player beginer
content:
Simple; you'll need to lure one of the Shikadi mines (Those black things that follow you and blow up.) next to it, then get it to blow up; it will blow up the orb and end the game for you. (It doesn't matter if it kills you at the same time.)Szevvy Forever!
And Spleen never!

title: Re: uuuh
content: Yeah, but you left out the part where you slaughtered a good portion of an intelligent, civilized race. What kind of a hero does that make you now, huh?

title: Re: uuuh
content:
Oh you've got it all wrong; after Keen defeats Mortimer, having slaughtered hundreds of innocent Vorticon, men women and children, even burning a nursery to the ground, the remaining Vorts hail Keen as their new leader from fear he'll blast what's left of them if they complain. (Besides, he's too young to prosecute for war crimes.)

Keen however has no wish to rule, instead desiring to seek out other planets upon which to begin a reign of terror. As a means of appeasement they offer him all the candy he can carry and a ig shiny medal. In return Keen lets them live and goes on a week long sugar high with friends from school that somehow ends with a fifty foot expletive being laser blasted onto Earth's moon.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: more!
content:
Oh, I don't know, they seem perfectly fine to me, just a bit autistic.

[quote]Quote:[hr]How fast can that thing go, anyway? *snorts several Tart Stix, and then downs a Keg of Vitalin as a chaser*[hr][/quote]

Now this is interesting; we do know that the galaxy is 100'000 light years across. Keen has to cross the Galaxy to fight the Shikadi, and this takes several hundred furious games of paddle war. (Which is basically pong.) Given the estimated average length of a pong game is 2:15 (Oh so close to the magic number!) that leaves us with 100'000 light years in 4-30 hours. This gives us a top speed of 2.36 x 10^20 kilometers an hour. (Screw you America.)Szevvy Forever!
And Spleen never!

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.jpg[/img]

title: Re: more!
content:
The US standard system can easily be used in the United States and, as it turns out, Liberia. (And it is apparently used unofficially in the UK, where it originated.) [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-british.gif[/img]

In all other countries, they use their terrorist metric system, which uses ever-so-inconvenient multiples of ten and impossibly confusing Greek roots on all the measurements, as opposed to easy-to-remember things like gallons, ounces, and fun things nobody actually ever uses like stones and furlongs. One day, we will all be able to ask for a hogshead of milk or booze or what have you (that's, like, 63 gallons or something.) Wouldn't life be so much easier if everybody measured that way instead?

I know, it would be.[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

We got rid of Harvy in an appropriate manner. Harvy was simply... kinda out of control really. I HIGHLY doubt he killed himself over the PCKF. If he DID he's an real hero.
